answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Tumor headache usually presents with pain that progressively worsens,  vomiting, possible visual disturbances, speech or personality changes; problems with equilibrium, gait, or coordination; and seizures. Imaging modalities such as CT scan will help rule this out. Sinus headaches, on the other hand, may present with pain that often increase in severity throughout day. It may be caused by acute infection, nasal polyps, anatomical deformities, such as a deviated septum, that block the sinus ducts. This can be treat with antibiotics, decongestants, and surgical drainage if necessary. Have this checked by your  ENT to rule out sinus infection.  Take care and do keep us posted.

question: After 6 months of watching diet for diagnosis of Type 2 Diabetes, I started taking Meformin.  Right before I started taking Metformin, headaches began.  They are very frequent, sharp on the right side, feel pressure throughout temple-eyes-ears, have one spot middle of back of head that sort of tingles most of the time - very annoying at night, headaches are horrible when getting up from sitting position and coughing, Alieve helps in about an hour but don't want to become dependent on any over the counter medicine, would rather know the cause and work on that.  I have been driving quite a bit (5000 miles each month) in different climates so I have not ruled out sinus headaches - they just don't have a rhyme or reason to when they start or stop.  Lying down at night is hard to find a position, sometimes starts a headache.  Mornings are typically very good - headache starting afternoon most days.  Worried about secondary brain cancer and primary brain cancer or some other disease such as meningitis.  Neck is stiff on both sides and also has sharp pain from time to time which also starts a headache.  Eyes feel pressure, throat feels thick.  I do have a goiter and have been on thyroid medicine for about 30 years - have it checked regularly.  Nothing else has changed.  Anyone have any ideas or know how to rule out some things,. I don't even know which doctor type to see.  Thanks...
title: headaches
